intro: Sphaerocionium hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy spiky globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiky, globular inflorescence and hairy stems and leaves. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and bloom in the summer months.
